node.display_long_description:
Enjoy VR like never before by having full control of your hands and fingers to interact physically with your environment and many different objects and experiences! 

Discover the unique universe of Hand Physics Lab where you will need to fulfill a variety of tasks and puzzles with nothing but your hands!

You will go through more than 80 different puzzles and experiences to unlock multiple playgrounds where you will have full freedom to draw, build and play!

From painting eggs with your fingers, building cube towers, using magnets and telekinesis, shaking hands with your clone, petting a virtual cat, and so much more!

You will definitely put your hands in action!

**Fully playable with hand tracking and/or touch controllers**

nodes.title: Update 1.0.1 - Difficulty Adjustments & Hotfixes
nodes.body_text:
Update 1.0.1 - Difficulty Adjustments & Hotfixes

This update addresses difficulty of puzzles and some minor bug fixes.
It is now easier to reach 2 and 3 stars and it requires less stars to unlock the different playgrounds!

üëç IMPROVEMENTS

- Adjusted puzzles difficulty to make it easier to get 2 and 3 stars
- Less stars are required to unlock sandboxes
- Telekinesis Sorting puzzle: moved wall further away, and first bowl aligned to others
- Advanced Egg Painting: added lines on egg to display the painting zones
- Improved tin cans physics

üîß BUG FIXES

- Fixed Calibrator hands drifting issues
- Fixed bug with objects not rescaling when respawning and being reset at the same time
- Can shooting puzzles (Gun and Balls) correctly auto finishes if all cans are down
- Magnet puzzle correctly resets itself
- Baskull Ball: skull respawns correctly after every shot

Ability to skip puzzles will be added in the next update üëç

Full Changelog

node.reviewDescription:
Hand tracking has limitations on the quest so this game can‚Äôt really reach its full potential. So that part isn‚Äôt the games fault. If we ignore this I would‚Äôve easily given it a 5 stars if it was  free as I don‚Äôt think the price justifies for the content. You‚Äôll play this game for 10 minutes and then never touch it again. It‚Äôs just a cool presentation of what hand tracking can do but it‚Äôs no more than that. It‚Äôs a tech demo not a game, and I personally don‚Äôt think the price is right.

However, the puzzles in the game are really fun and if you really think you‚Äôll enjoy this game you might get a couple of hours of content out if here. 

Grind: If you want to unlock game modes for the sandbox mode you can play trough the puzzles and unlock stars which will then unlock new gamemodes in the sandbox mode
Replayability: not really any replay value unless you want to collect all the stars and really like the puzzles

The game itself is good, but there isn‚Äôt much to keep you coming back for more which is understandable as this isn‚Äôt really a game and more of an experience. I would prefer if the game was free (I really want to support the devs but this is more of a showcase on what VR can do than something I‚Äôd pay for so idk.)
I do recommend it especially if you‚Äôre interested in hand tasking. But the hand tracking isn‚Äôt the best and this isn‚Äôt the devs fault but the Hardware. 

I‚Äôll give it a 7/10

developerResponse.body:
Hi YucciBoi, thanks for your honest and detailed feedback!

Hand tracking is still currently the main factor that will influence the quality of your experience in Hand Physics Lab.

The quality of hand tracking heavily depends on the conditions of your environment, here are some tricks to optimize it:
- Have good lighting in the room
- No direct sunlight or glares from windows
- Good contrast between the color of your hands and the background. 
- Keep both hands in the field of view and not obstructing one another
- Try to not move your hands too fast in general
Hope this helps!

The way you will be able to unlock experiments in the sandbox will be improved in the next update and have a more satisfying progression system.
A lot more content will be added in upcoming updates, stay tuned!
